data.title: Buzzing place, decent food, affordable drinks
data.text:
Went for late night dinner -  arrived at 915pm on a Wednesday. Kitchen open til 11pm. Busy enough, not full by any means. Buzzing atmosphere. Low lighting.

Not an extensive food menu. Its 'upper pub' food. Solid drinks menu !!

Salmon was nice. BBQ Ribs were great. No vegetables or salad or fries but enough to eat.

Affordable, reasonable prices. No pressure staff. No wifi available for diners.

Pretty good place for late night dinner and drinks. Recommended -  sure. There's better out there but its in Redondo and it works well. Wont break the bank.

data.title: Small Plates and micro brew/cocktails
data.text:
A group of 4 of us went in and shared a bunch of small plates.  All items were good, but of particular note were the ribs, beef cheeks and cauliflower steak.  

Good selection of micro brews, a number of different/unique cocktails to choice from, as well as an assortment of wines, scotches, gins and tequilas.

Liked the atmosphere.  Little dark.  Various assortment of dining area choices -- bar, tables, booth seating, and high tables.  Brick walls, with reclaimed wood.  Trendy.

Would definitely return.

data.title: Great atmosphere, good beer selection
data.text: My partner and I made the 30 minute walk out to Hudson House from Hermosa Beach because we were looking for a place with a great beer selection. Hudson House was great! The toasted pretzel bites with cheese were a delicious snack, though we wished we'd ordered the hanger steak after seeing it on someone else's table! The location is quite remote but I liked the atmosphere and the service was great. I'd go back.

data.title: Great Find!
data.text: We went to Hudson House based on a recommendation from some locals and could not have been more pleased. Very extensive drinks menu (lots of great beers and whiskeys) and an eclectic menu with something for every taste. We had a selection of dishes and felt the Red Salad and Ribs were the highlights. Our waiter was very helpful with tips on the menu.

data.title: Just go!
data.text: I am From out of town and we always make it a point to go there when I roll in. Sazeracs! Yummy! Food-consistently tasty! But the best thing is the milk and cookies. Bourbon milk of course! Great Bartenders, great kitchen. Just go!

data.title: Great Happy Hour
data.text:
I've been here twice so far and really like everything about this place. The first time I came for dinner and ordered the pretzel burger and steak, both were very good. The second time around I came for happy hour and sat at the bar. Happy hour offers cheap beers and some specials on apps. We shared two apps and ordered the chicken caesar sandwich which was so good! 

Parking along PCH wasn't bad and there are plenty of spots along the side streets as well.

data.title: Hudson House is a great place on any evening
data.text: Great chef, great gourmet bar food. The bucket of fires with aioli on the side is a favorite. The chef is first class. The beer is excellent.

data.title: Casual meal with great flavor & winning beer selection
data.text:
Came here with a group of 12 coworkers around 7 on a Wednesday night and ended up magically snagging a bunch of tables all together. Definitely recommend a reservation for anyone looking to seat more than 2 though!

We mostly ordered small plates to share with a few folks ordering larger plates like burgers for their own. At about 1.5-2 small plates per person, we had plenty of food. The ribs definitely stood out along with the toasted edamame. The hangar steak was the best by far although the lamb paneer and sweet corn cake were also favorites of the table. 

This place is dimly lit and got loud, so it was good that we were in a bigger group and could hold many smaller conversations. With a medium sized group of 5-6, it would be hard for everyone to talk/listen to just one person. 

But let's face it, the beer selection is really what will get you here! With a great selection, you can spend the whole evening trying different beers. Our waitress had a hard time keeping track of selections, even if she only took three orders at a time, she'd come back with two beers and forget the third. But she was polite and attentive otherwise, so really no complaints about service. 

If I'm back in town, I will definitely try this again

data.title: gotta try the ribs
data.text: OMG the spare ribs are to die for best in CALIF and the cheesy fries OMG yum um yum - great ambience trendy bar and good vibe

data.title: GO…NOW!
data.text: I loved everything about this place.  The casual feel of the open room, really laid back bartenders and a killer cocktail menu. I couldn't decide between one of the bottle beers on the long list of many or a siracha watermelon margarita…i had both. Followed up with kale grit fritters of some sort, half a burger with my fiancé and I was a happy kid.  A happy drunk kid...

data.title: Great little gastropub in the South Bay
data.text: Great little NYC-style gastropub and restaurant with a great wine and beer list. Ambiance is upscale but still casual with exposed brick. Food is good too-- try the grits appetizer (not what you expect). Owned by a husband and wife team Brooke Williamson and Nick Roberts (she competed on Top Chef) with two other local restaurants. Always busy on the weekends with a late 20-something to early 40-something crowd.

data.title: Great meal!
data.text: We visited our friends in Huntington Beach this weekend and they had to take us to their favorite restaurant. It definitely lived up to the hype! I had the hot chicken and it was very good! Loved the biscuit. My husband had the hanger steak (my friends husbands go-to dish) and loved it as well! His fries with truffle oil and cheese were to die for! They have a great drink selection as well.

data.title: Still missing the burger
data.text: I was there with a friend and the burger was delicious. Haven't found anything comparable in Germany yet.

data.title: Excellent Ribs!
data.text: We went for drinks and appetizers, but made a meal of the ribs and fries!  I know that doesn't sound very SoCal, but the ribs were an interesting flavor that we loved. Great vibe here, although loud and crowded.

data.title: Best in Southbay!
data.text: This is one great restaurant! Been here many times and will always go back. High quality chef made to perfection food for a reasonable price. Cocktails are unique and delicious! Almost had everything on the menus never dissapointed. Mouthwatering food. Thank you to the team for the hard work, I can't wait to visit again. if you like spicy cocktails you will become addicted to the watermelon margarita... Trust me. Everything is fantastic here. Enjoy

data.title: Gem of a Restaurant in Redondo Beach…Great for Beer too!
data.text: Just tried Hudson House.  It is mainly a bar with limited menu.  However the food is fantastic.  Two of us tried 4 small plates to share. Everything was fabulous!  Compliments to the chef.  I heard he won Top Chef in the past.  I can't wait to try different items on the menu next time.

data.title: Awesome Vibe & Food
data.text: I'm a regular here and always love the food and service. They have an extensive list of beer and create their own mixed drinks that are pretty good. The wine list is OK for my taste, but I can always find something I want. The burger is the best in LA, and even better when paired with sweet potato fries. Get extra of the aioli. The mac and cheese is some of the best I've ever head, and is great paired with the ribs.

data.title: Love it here.
data.text: Have eaten here many times now and always enjoyed it.  Would recommend this to anyone interested in trying new and interesting things.  Pretzel burger amazing, so is the flat iron steak.

data.title: Fun!!
data.text: We had a great time this weekend, we sat at the bar as the place was super busy...the bartender was fantastic and made our drinks perfectly and he also took our food orders and made recommendations on more drinks hahahaha good bartender as we took every drink he said and they were just perfect...this is now our third visit and we will continue on going. By the way the Mac and cheese is amazing!!!!

data.title: Great food...too loud!
data.text: I've been here 5 times. Food is good (Brussels sprouts recommended), service a 4 or 5, depending. Nice cocktail menu with some unusual drinks. Don't think I'll be going back though (at least not past about 5:30) because I hate having to yell to be heard by the rest of my group. Went home hoarse last time...hate that (I feel the same about Fish Bar in MB). Bummed.
